embed.description: README.TXT*** Ping improvement concept for Danger, On My Way and Assist Me. The circle and arrow thing would appear if your screen is in a certain range of the ping. It would also move around the edge when you move your screen. Enemy Missing not included because I wasn't too sure how it could be improved.

replies.body: I like the concept, but it would be annoying to see a danger ping that's all the way across the map. What if there was a range at which it would show the pings outside your screen?
Change the opacity based on how far away it is. For example: A solid ping means it's very close. A faint one is very far away.

This would probably ruin wards, but what if you could drop timers down, like you see a 3 minute ward placed, you drop a ping on the ward that stays there for three minutes (and so on for pinks, trinket wards, etc)?

Interesting thought, but wards already have timers on them - both the little white bar beneath their health and the numeric countdown in the upper-left corner of the screen when said ward is targeted.

If you were talking about giant floating ward timers, though, then they'd either be very helpful or a major distraction.

And if you were talking about enemy wards instead of allied ones, then this ping would never be enabled - why merely mark an enemy ward with a ping when you could just destroy it on sight?

Because  it's not always an advantageous time to destroy a ward when an enemy has dropped one. Perhaps an enemy dropped one as they were running away with low health. Or maybe removing the ward at that particular moment would result in receiving enemy attacks. Or perhaps simply, a method of revealing the ward isn't available because the lens was used recently and is still on cooldown.

Additionally, there can be advantages to leaving an enemy ward up, and sneaking around it for a gank from a direction an enemy thought was safe.

Having a method to indicate wards would be really nice, as not everyone uses voice chat, people may have chat restrictions, and/or standing around to type in to chat about enemy ward locations is not always opportune.
